data.title: What is Gene Hackman's net worth?
data.meta_description: GENE Hackman's filmography spans decades of movie and TV appearances.The Oscar winner is known for Mississippi Burning, Superman, and The French Conne
data.text:
GENE Hackman's filmography spans decades of movie and TV appearances.

The Oscar winner is known for Mississippi Burning, Superman, and The French Connection.

What is Gene Hackman's net worth?

According to Celebrity Net Worth, Gene Hackman has an estimated fortune of $80million.

Gene's net worth is attributed to his several years as a successful Hollywood actor and novelist.

After years of landing bit parts in the late 1950s into the 1960s, he went on to achieve his career breakthrough in the latter part of the decade.

During the late 1960s, Gene earned recognition for his roles in Lilith, Bonnie and Clyde, Hawaii, and Downhill Racer.

The Golden Globe winner's list of movie appearances also includes:

I Never Sang for My Father

The French Connection

Prime Cut

The Poseidon Adventure

The Conversation

Young Frankenstein

French Connection II

A Bridge Too Far

Superman

Superman II

Reds

Superman IV: The Quest for Peace

Mississippi Burning

Postcards From the Edge

Unforgiven

Get Shorty

The Birdcage

Enemy of the State

The Replacements

Heartbreakers

The Royal Tenanbaums

Runaway Jury

Aside from acting on screen, Hackman is an accomplished novelist.

In 1999, he and his writing partner Daniel Lenihan published their first novel Wake of the Perdido Star.

What movie did Hackman win the Oscar for?

At the 1972 Academy Awards, Hackman won his first Oscar for The French Connection.

At the 1993 telecast, he took home the gold for his performance in the Clint Eastwood western Unforgiven.

Over the course of his career, the Academy has nominated him a total of five times.

Hackman was recognized by the organization for his performances in Bonnie and Clyde, I Never Sang For My Father, and Mississippi Burning.

When did Hackman retire?

On July 7, 2004, Hackman announced his plans to retire during an interview with Larry King.

On June 5, 2008, he officially revealed he was retiring from acting.

The award-winning star attributed his retirement to his doctor's advice regarding his heart's condition.

Hackman told EMPIRE: "The straw that broke the camel’s back was actually a stress test that I took in New York.

"The doctor advised me that my heart wasn’t in the kind of shape that I should be putting it under any stress.

"When I’m actually on the set or on a stage, actually doing the work, I loved that process and I loved the creative process of trying to bring a character to life."

He further explained: "Whereas the business part of show business is kinda wicked, it’s kind of a frying pan.

"It was jarring and at my age and with my health, I decided I didn’t want to do that any longer.

"The agents don’t want me to say it, in case something good comes along but I’m officially retired. No doubt about it."

Where does Hackman live?

Hackman resides on a large 12-acre property he and his wife Betsy remodeled and designed in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

He previously owned a 25-acre property in Montecito, California in the 1980s, which he sold for a cool $5.5 million in 1985.

He also had a home in Pebble Beach, California that he sold in 1993.
